column4: is anyone having problems using Sound Juicer to rip audio CDs?  I get a "No CD-ROM drives found error".
Have you cheecked the preferences in sj to see if the drive is there, or does it give you that error and exit?
I can't get into SJ's preferences menu, because once it shows me the error and I click ok, it just exits.
Are you able to mount Data CDs in it all right?
yes, I can read the install CD and other data CDs with no problem.
Have you checked the permissions of the device?
how do i check the permissions of the device?  sorry, i'm a newbie.
Thats fine. Is the drive an IDE drive?
It is a USB2 external DVD/CDRW.
Ah ok. Run this: sudo modprobe sg
ok, i did that.
Now try and run sound-juicer again
you are a genius, it worked!!!
Glad to hear it.
do i need to do that everytime I log in?
No I was just about to suggest how to take care of that. Open up the /etc/modules file and add sg to the end on a separate line.
You need to do that with sudo.
done!
thanks...you've been a terrific help!
You are welcome.
just out of curiousity, what is the module sg for?
It is SCSI generic support. Since you are using a USB drive, all USB drives use the SCSi subsystem in Linux. For some reason sound-juicer needs this loaded in order to work with SCSI CD drives.
thanks for that fix.  i will post that in ubuntuforums.org for others to discover.
Sounds like a good idea.
